Summary Heading: Not as bad as some have reviewed.
Summary: I stayed here October 12, 2019. To be honest, I read previous reviews and was worried.  No need to worry.  It's pretty standard for an 'all suite, extended stay' type of property.  I rarely saw other residents, but when I did they were friendly, though some were needing some laundry services.  It was quiet, no activity in the parking lot, which was very well-lit.  The grab and go breakfast was underwhelming, but I got a couple of granola bars and a coffee for free.  With that said, I would probably opt to stay at another place if not constrained by the company-paid travel agency.  I've stayed at worse places, but not on purpose. ;)
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. We are pleased overall you enjoyed your stay and hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back soon for a much better experience.  Sincerely,  Hotel Management

The majority of clientele were obviously on some sort of public housing stipend, however nothing on website alerts you to this. Unpleasant cooking smells permeated the hallways. Our next door neighbors had a penchant for curry and it was gag inducing at times. Lots of trash, old tires and even a Jet Ski in green areas surrounding parking lot. Breakfast offered was only coffee, tea, packaged muffins and Granola bars. We didnt want to spend a lot of money for a place to sleep and shower but it felt more like a homeless shelter than a hotel for vacationers. Staff was nice.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincerest apologies for the disappointing stay you had and regret our hotel did not meet your expectations. Summary Heading: 17 Months at Extended Stay America Report
Summary: I spent 17 months at this hotel and truly appreciated the location, the staff and the other residents. The location is great - modern shopping centers with every retailer you can think of are a couple blocks away. The beaches are about a 20 minute drive. The mountains about 1.5 hour drive.  Lake Forest is a relatively small city and is quiet for the most part. There are so many parks in the area - we made it to about 5 or 6 of them, however there were many more that we didn't get the opportunity visit. About the staff... Jay is the manager and was there the entire 17 months. Terry Young, housekeeping, became like family to us. She was amazing. I wrote her a great reference letter. Muhammad and Alex are very special - they work the front desk. There are residents at the hotel
Manager Response: Barbara,   Thank you for your wonderful review. We are pleased that you enjoyed your visit to Extended Stay America. Summary: Convenient location, helpful staff, adequate amenities.  Property is older, in need of renovations, but fairly clean.  Kitchenette was nice, but when advertised available items were requested (coffee maker, dishes, cookware, etc.), front desk informed us they were nearly booked up, and so not all items were available, and we should check for them tomorrow.  The hotel should have supplies available for all rooms.  Bath towels were extremely thin, and often stained. Bed was not comfortable, and on wheels that don't lock, so that it moved away from the wall if you tried to sit up with your back to the wall watching TV.  Was in the area on business for a month.  Found a better hotel nearby for the same rate.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We're glad our location was ideal for you and that you were pleased with the service provided by our associates. I will be returning once I start back up at work in the area, and am very much looking forward it. On the plus size having a full size fridge in the room was nice and the coffee which is not in the room but in the main lobby was good. The staff when we did encounter them were always nice. The grab n go breakfast worked as advertised (granola bars, fruit, pre-packaged muffins, coffee). The laundry room looked clean and bright but I didn't use it. My parent's stayed at an Extended Stay in Irvine earlier this year and had the same complaint about the beds - so I should have listed to them...Never again will I stay here....but the staff causes me to give out the second star.

Summary: We stayed here one night because our house was being repaired, and we have a small dog that we needed a pet friendly hotel.  Well, we should have done our homework.  Room was horrible, smoke detector was hanging off the ceiling, toilet was broke, plug in kitchen didn't work, and beds were so hard and noisey that we didn't get much sleep.  Next room was partying all night.  Laid awake most of the night, at 6:30am, I asked my husband if it was too early to get up and get the Hell out of here.  Checked out by 8:00am and stopped by the Residence Inn by Marriott and checked in.  Loved them and stayed until we could go back home.  Never will stay an Extended Stay again.  Very trashy.
